revised_title: Stabilization and Assembly of Brome Mosaic Virus: RNA-Protein Interactions and Capsid Stability
tldr: This article discusses the stabilization and assembly of brome mosaic virus, focusing on the role of RNA-protein interactions and capsid stability. The authors explore the different conformations of the virus and the forces responsible for its structure, including hydrophobic and electrostatic interactions. They also investigate the formation of empty capsids and the conditions required for in vitro morphogenesis.
